In other words, $\mathcal A \cup \bar {\mathcal A} = \mathcal V$ and $\mathcal A \cap \bar {\mathcal A} = \emptyset$. item.title: Graph Convolution Operator
item.description: For a given graph $\mathcal G$, we have an attribute on each node, denoted as $f_v$. All the node attributes put together can be written as a list $\mathbf f\to (f_{v_1}, f_{v_2}, \cdots, f_{v_N})$. Convolution on graph is combining attributes on nodes with their neighbors'.
